====United States====
====United States====
â
As of [[May 2006]], there is no federal legislation specifically barring sex with a corpse.<ref>[http://www.burknet.com/robsfantasy/section3a.html Section 3a<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Multiple states have their own laws:
+
As of [[May 2006]], there is no federal legislation specifically barring sex with a corpse.<ref
â   â
*[[Alabama]] - Class C [[felony]] under [http://www.legislature.state.al.us/CodeofAlabama/1975/13A-11-13.htm 13A-11-13]
  â
*[[Alaska]] - Class A [[misdemeanor]] under [http://touchngo.com/lglcntr/akstats/Statutes/Title11/Chapter61/Section130.htm 11-61-130]
  â
*[[Arkansas]] - Class D felony under [http://170.94.58.9/NXT/gateway.dll/ARCode/title03839.htm/subtitle04512.htm/chapter04513.htm/subchapter04514/section04515.htm 5-60-101]
  â
*[[California]] - Illegal, up to three years in prison (a bill before the legislature would raise the penalty to 8 years){{Fact|date=May 2008}}
  â
*[[Colorado]] - Class 2 misdemeanor under [http://198.187.128.12/colorado/lpext.dll/Infobase4/29db9/2dc8a/2dca6?f=templates&fn=document-frame.htm&2.0#JD_18-13-101 18-13-101]
  â
*[[Connecticut]] - Class A misdemeanor under [http://www.cga.ct.gov/2001/pub/Chap952.htm#sec53a-65.htm 53a-73a]
  â
*[[Delaware]] - Class A misdemeanor under [http://www.delcode.state.de.us/title11/c005/sc07/index.htm#P400_34785 11-5-1332]
  â
*[[Florida]] - Second degree felony under chapter [http://www.leg.state.fl.us/STATUTES/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&Search_String=&URL=Ch0872/Sec06.HTM 872.06]
  â
*[[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] - Felony, up to 10 years in prison under [http://www.ganet.org/cgi-bin/pub/ocode/ocgsearch?docname=OCode/G/16/6/7&highlight=necrophilia 16-6-7]
  â
*[[Hawaii]] - Misdemeanor under [http://www.capitol.hawaii.gov/hrscurrent/vol14_ch0701-0853/hrs0711/hrs_0711-1108.htm 7]
  â
*[[Iowa]] - Class D felony under [http://www.legis.state.ia.us/IACODE/1999SUPPLEMENT/709/18.html 709.18]
  â
*[[Minnesota]] and [[Nevada]] also have laws prohibiting necrophilia<ref>as described in the footnote on page 43 of Mary Roach's bestselling book ''Stiff: The Curious Lives of Human Cadavers''</ref>
  â
*[[Ohio]] - Second/fifth degree misdemeanor under [http://codes.ohio.gov/orc/2927.01 2927.01]
  â
*[[Oregon]] - Felony for "Abuse of Corpse" [http://www.leg.state.or.us/ors/166.html ORS 166.085]
  â
*[[Pennsylvania]] - Second degree misdemeanor under [http://members.aol.com/StatutesP7/18PA5510.html Title 18 Â§5510]
  â
*[[Texas]] - Class A misdemeanor [http://tlo2.tlc.state.tx.us/statutes/docs/PE/content/pdf/pe.009.00.000042.00.pdf]
  â
*[[Washington]] - Class C felony for "Sexually violating human remains" [http://apps.leg.wa.gov/RCW/default.aspx?cite=9A.44.105 RCW 9A.44.105]
  â
* [[Wisconsin]] - Class G felony under [http://www.wicourts.gov/sc/opinion/DisplayDocument.html?content=html&seqNo=33332 940.225 (7)]
